p: Bacteria have proven effective against several fungal pathogens of agronomic crops and forest trees [ 259], but in significantly fewer cases against armillarioid forest pathogens. Bacterial antagonism is achieved by different mechanisms, including antibiosis, competition for nutrients and resistance induced in the host [ 260]. Other factors that influence the efficacy of biocontrol bacteria are their capacity to colonize the rhizosphere or the host and to adapt to soil conditions.
